results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/39]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The international scene - the Franco-Soviet “Grand Commission” meets in Paris; OECD Colloquy in Nice. 2. 82 years young - Maurice Chevalier celebrates his 82nd birthday. 3. Thoroughbreds - breeding race horses. 4. Poetry for all - accent on poetry in a Paris book-store; applying modern methods in a Lille bookshop. 5. Surfboard lifeguards - On France’s Atlantic seaboard, a new vocation for surf-riding.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/38]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The European swimming championships - French swimmers in good shape during the first days of the European championships at Barcelone. 2. The centennial of the French Republic - the Third Republic is 100 years old. What it has stood for. 3. A modern hospital - the new Ambroise Pare Hospital in Paris. 4. Tribute to Francois Mauriac - excerpts from film sequences shot in the French writer’s Malagar estate shortly before his death.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/36]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The new port of Saint-Raphael - new basins with space for many more pleasure-craft. 2. The Palais de la Decouverte - the major scientific discoveries made understandable to all. 3. Summer pop songs at Saint Tropez - the season’s hits in this vacationland. 4. Jean and Francois Clouet at the Court of France - the works of a dynasty of portrait artists revives a whole period of French history. 5. The City of Nice - a rapidly expanding city, the fifth largest in France.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/33]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Fashions - Ted Lapidus’ new “long line”. 2. Europe and space - after the conferences in Bonn and NASA and that of Brussels, Europe reorganises ELDO and ESRO. 3. The arts - the “floor and wall” exhibition at the Decorative Arts; Canvases by Empress Farah and her children in a provincial exhibition. 4. In the bowels of the earth - tourism in the french grottoes: Padirac, the Aven Armand and Rouffignac with its prehistoric paintings.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/32]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The French track and field championships - At the Colombes Olympic Stadium, near Paris, good performances turned in by the French athletes. 2. Underneath Place de L’Etoile - underneath the Arch of Triumph, the new tunnel. 3. Today’s movie-makers - Francois Truffaud’s new film: “The Child of the Wilderness”. 4. The Avignon Festival - the Dramatic Arts Festival of Avignon has just taken place. 5. Music, first and foremost - in Aix-en Provence, the Music Festival has started with Herbert Von Karajan.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/30]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Bastille Day - includes the traditional street-dances and fireworks display and the morning parade on the Champs-Elysees. 2. Throwback to the mad twenties - a famous musical comedy makes a come-back. 3. Today’s newspaperwomen - Francoise Giroud, reporter, editor and editorialist…a woman who works 12 hours a day in the fever of the news-room as managing-director of the weekly EXPRESS. 4. Roger Pierre and Jean-Marc Thibault - the best French comedy duo in a new skit.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/28]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Summer hats - hat models by Barthet. 2. Paris porcelain - an exhibition at Sevres presents a half-century of French porcelain craftsmanship. 3. Simplifying life - the 50th anniversary of the standardisation movement in France. 4. Georges van Parys - France’s leading composer of film music reminisces on his work. 5. Saint Louis, or virtue on the throne - the 700th anniversary of the death of the saintly King Louis IX.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/25]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Sports - competitors from five nations in the Paris-Strasbourg “walkathon”. 2. Techniques - the new, ultra-modern “Etendard” express train, linking Paris to Bordeaux in four and a half hours. 3. At Arzwiller, a new Moselle River “boat-lift”, doing the work of ten locks. 4. Plane and helicopter rotor-research at the Modane Onera wind-tunnel. 5. The bulls of Camargue - cattle-rustling in Camargue. 6. European art - sponsored by the European Economic Council, an exhibition on “European art in 1925”.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/23]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. A new city - about a “prime example” of modern city planning in the city of Sarcelles. A city that began as a major housing project but which became a city in its own right. 2. Techniques “Expomar” - an expo of machinery and other techniques relevant to urban planning. Mirabelle - about MIR506, destined for the Soviet Union. 3. Francois Tracanelli - pole vault champion. 4. The arts: an art gallery featuring lithographs. Also featuring lithographs and sculpture of Ossip Zadkine.
